intro: Cordyline fontanesiana, commonly known as the New Zealand cabbage tree, is a striking evergreen plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, sword-shaped leaves that can grow up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces striking white or pink flower spikes that emerge from the leaf axils, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its unique appearance and resilience make it a notable botanical specimen in both horticulture and natural ecosystems.
